00022         : public ConfigBase

00061 
00063 // IFMech definition
00064 // models an integrate-&-fire neuron
00066 
00067 class IFMech
00068 {
00069 protected:
00070     explicit IFMech(ConfigBase * const configurator);
00071     template <class TypeImpl> void perform_calculations(TypeImpl & neuron);
00072     const Volt & potential_impl() const {
00073         return v[1];
00074     }
00075 private:
00076     const IFMechConfig * const ifmcfg_;
00077     double v[2];  // membrane potential at consecutive time steps (mV)
00078     double alpha[2], beta[2]; // Array of working variables.  See Shelly&Tao. ( s^-1, mV/s)
00079 //  double * alphasyn, * betasyn; // Array of working variables recording k for each presynpase so this doesn't need to be recalculated.
00080     double k[2]; // Array of working variable. See Shelly&Tao. (mV/s)
00081     Size refrac_time_left_;
00082 };
00083 
00084 
00085 
00087 // inline definitions
00089 
00091 // constructor
00092 inline IFMech::IFMech(ConfigBase * const configurator)
00093         : ifmcfg_(dynamic_cast<IFMechConfig *>(configurator))
00094 {
00095     if (! ifmcfg_) throw ConfigError("IFMech: void configurator");
00096     v[0] = v[1] = ifmcfg_->Vr();
00097     alpha[0] = alpha[1] = 1.0 / ifmcfg_->tauP();
00098     beta[0] = beta[1] = ifmcfg_->Vp() / ifmcfg_->tauP();
00099     k[0] = k[1] = 0;
00100     refrac_time_left_ = 0;
00101 }
00102 
00104 // mechanism called to update the state of the neuron
00105 template <class TypeImpl>
00106 inline void IFMech::perform_calculations(TypeImpl & neuron)
00107 {
00108     double time_to_spike;
00109 
00110     // Update v;
00111     v[0] = v[1];
00112 
00113     // test if in refractory period
00114     if (refrac_time_left_ > 0) {
00115         --refrac_time_left_;
00116     } else {
00117         // Calculate alpha0 and beta0  in Shelly&Tao
00118         alpha[0] = alpha[1];
00119         beta[0] = beta[1];
00120         k[0] = -alpha[0] * v[0] + beta[0];  // calculate k1;
00121         alpha[1] = 1.0 / ifmcfg_->tauP();    // initialise
00122         beta[1] = ifmcfg_->Vp() / ifmcfg_->tauP();
00123 
00124         // sum all synaptic contributions (continuous or impulsive conductance and current):
00125         for (typename TypeImpl::ListSynMechType::const_iterator i = neuron.presynmechlist_impl().begin();
00126                 i != neuron.presynmechlist_impl().end();
00127                 ++i)
00128             (*i)->send_updated_states(alpha[1], beta[1]);
00129 
00130         // increment v[1] with estimated integral over SimEnv::timestep() of continuous current
00131         k[1] = -alpha[1] * (v[0] + SimEnv::timestep() * k[0]) + beta[1];
00132         v[1] = v[0] + SimEnv::timestep() * (k[0] + k[1]) / 2.0;
00133 
00134         if (v[1] > ifmcfg_->Vth()) { // the neuron spikes!
00135             // determine the exact time of the next spike:
00136             time_to_spike = SimEnv::timestep() * (ifmcfg_->Vth() - v[0]) / (v[1] - v[0]);
00137             // corrections
00138             if (time_to_spike < 0) {
00139                 time_to_spike = 0;
00140 #ifdef _DEBUG
00141                 std::cout << "IFMech: negative time_to_spike";
00142 #endif
00143             } else if (time_to_spike >= SimEnv::timestep()) {
00144                 time_to_spike = 0;
00145 #ifdef _DEBUG
00146                 std::cout << "IFMech: too large time_to_spike";
00147 #endif
00148             }
00149 
00150             v[0] = ifmcfg_->Vr() - time_to_spike * (beta[0] + beta[1] - alpha[1] * beta[0] * SimEnv::timestep()) / 2.0;
00151             v[0] /= 1.0 + time_to_spike * (-alpha[0] - alpha[1] + alpha[0] * alpha[1] * SimEnv::timestep()) / 2.0;
00152             k[0] = -alpha[0] * v[0] + beta[0];
00153             k[1] = -alpha[1] * (v[0] + SimEnv::timestep() * k[0]) + beta[1];
00154             v[1] = v[0] + SimEnv::timestep() * (k[0] + k[1]) / 2.0;
00155 
00156             // effect the consequences of the spike:
00157             neuron.notify_firing_impl(time_to_spike);
00158 
00159             // start the refractory period
00160             refrac_time_left_ = ifmcfg_->refrac_per();
00161         }
00162     }
00163 }
00164 
00165 
00166 #endif // !defined(IFMECH_H)
